properties.name: Natural Fine Lamb Company
properties.description: Posted by Ahaden67794 Hwy 395 South, Pendleton, OR, 97801We simply couldn\'t compete with large industrial farms if we weren\'t able to market our lambs directly to you, the customer. You get a high-quality, hand-selected product and we are able to do what we love, produce high-quality Lamb. People have asked why we feel so strongly about supporting small family farms. The number one reason is quality. The second most important reason is knowing the meat you eat is produced humanely and with VERY low environmental impact. In fact, we have been working with wheat farmers in Eastern Oregon to provide natural weed control on fields that are rotated out of planting for the year. This creates a positive environmental impact by providing natural weed-control while the sheep and lambs get fat. The next time you buy lamb or beef from you local market or restaurant, ask where it is from. We have found 99% of the markets and restaurants we ask have no idea where or how the meat they serve/sale was raise or processed. We are working hard to increase awareness of how your meal was produced and who produced it. When you buy lamb from us, you know where, who and how it was produced. And you have our guarantee of a high-quality product.

We work to optimize the health and productivity of all our inputs and resources (i.e. soils, plants, animals and people). Our farm management directives include: Weed and pest control through grazing management Recycling plant and animal residues Water management Soil conservation Soil fertility management All of which enhances our ability to provide a balanced nutrient supply for plant and animal. properties.name: Southpark Seafood Grill & Wine Bar
properties.description: Posted by Ahaden 901 SW Salmon St, Portland, OR, 97205Southpark Seafood Grill and Wine Bar Located downtown in the heart of Portland\'s cultural district, Southpark Seafood Grill and Wine Bar draws upon the freshest Northwest seafood and produce available to create dishes inspired by the culinary traditions of the Mediterranean. Utilizing fresh local ingredients and the finest imported specialty foods, Southpark serves authentic Mediterranean inspired cuisine in a lively urban setting. A small plates menu in the wine bar, crafted in the Spanish tapas tradition, provides an opportunity to taste a palate of new flavors and unique presentations. Appreciating the culinary landscape of the Mediterranean regions would be incomplete without pairing the cuisine with the regions? wines. To complement the Southpark?s menu, a 130-bottle wine list focuses on wines from Portugal, Spain, France, Italy and Greece. In addition, the bar carries a collection of fine ports and sherries, premium liquors and a handful of local microbrews. Southpark offers guests a wine experience unlike any other in Portland with an award-winning wine list and program, comfortable yet sophisticated wine bar and innovative wine shop. The space preserves its urban, industrial roots, but softness has been added to the interiors by jewel-toned fabrics, restored wood floors, textured wall treatment, intricately designed mirrors, colorful artwork, and decorative iron railings and accents. Windows of the wine bar open out to the sidewalk, allowing tables to spill outdoors in the European caf tradition. Southpark has been recognized by Bon Appetit, Restaurant Hospitality, Sant and Sunset magazines as well as the Oregonian, The New York Times and The Seattle Times for excellence in food and wine and received a 2002 Monterey Wine Festival award for ?America?s Best Wine List: Fine Dining.?

properties.name: ford farms llc
properties.description: Posted by Ahaden 14940 nw gillihan rd, portland, OR, 97231We are on Sauvie Island, which is 20 minutes from downtown. We dry-age our beef (pasture raised) for 30 days, and never use any additives or growth hormones. We slaughter at a USDA facility. Our cider is made from exclusively from apples grown on our farm. We use organic control of scab, a mating disruption for codling moth, and ignore the other "pests". It is made on our farm, and like wine, takes a year to make.
